page.title: 16OUR D-BLOCK RAMBLES
page.content: Class 1 had three lovely days walking round parts of our D-Block. The first time was when we went for an afternoon sketching views from the hillside about{60 metres above the school.}We saw nearly all of the main buildings from{"The Rocks",}where we worked. We were visited by some inquisitive heifers, who wanted to find out who was making all the noise in their field! The second day we went all the way to the highest point of the D-Block, {Beacon Batch (484573).}It was a bright day and when we reached the summit we met a group of students from{London {University,}who were also doing a survey of their own. They explained how to use their valuable equipment. Our third trip was around the village, sketching interesting buildings or the details plants growing on walls.
